hedline.hl1: Two Banks Making Changes in Agencies

block.p: One financial institution is changing agencies and a second has placed its account in review.

The Fleet Financial Group in Boston named Clarion Direct in Greenwich, Conn., to handle the consolidated direct marketing account of its Fleet Bank division, with billings estimated at $25 million. The account had previously been divided among more than 10 agencies; Clarion Direct was not among them. The decision came after a three-month review that began with 16 agencies and was narrowed to Clarion Direct, which is a division of the Clarion Marketing and Communications unit of D'Arcy Masius Benton & Bowles, and 2 other finalists: Barry Blau & Partners in Westport, Conn., and Epsilon in Boston. Pile & Company in Boston managed the review.

Pile & Company in Boston managed the review.

And Duffy & Shanley Inc. in Providence, R.I., said that after nine years it had resigned the account of the Citizens Bank in Providence, with billings estimated at $6 million to $7 million. As a result, Citizens, which is owned by the Royal Bank of Scotland, has begun an informal closed review on the account.

The account was "so labor intensive" that it "proved to be uneconomical for us," said David A. Duffy, president at Duffy & Shanley, adding that the parting was amicable. Hal Tovin, executive vice president and marketing director at Citizens, said he would talk to a "select number of agencies, primarily in New England." A decision is expected within 90 days, he added.
